text: There was indeed a mild fragrance as I entered the garden. I wished that my handphone was able to record the smell! üòÇ The Healing Garden is next to it, so you can hit two places at one go.

Fragrant Garden is an area delicated to flora with fragrant flowers.
Some interesting ones on display are :
-Jasmine ËåâËéâËä±. The flowers are used to flavour teas and to make into perfumes. The white fragrant flowers are sometimes worn on the hair or make into garlands.
-Climbing Oleander aka Pink Allamanda due to its close resemblance to Allamanda.
-White Butterfly Ginger Lily ÂßúËä±. National flower of Cuba.
-Champaka or huang lan ÈªÑÂÖ∞. The fragrant flower are used for worship and garland making. Girls may worn them on their hair.
-Ylang-Ylang Perfume Tree ‰æùÂÖ∞. The oil from Ylang-Ylang is used in the famous Chanel No 5 perfume.

Unique arrangement of flowers in midair to maintain the shape of the flowers even as they wilt and to keep people from touching. There are not only amazing flowers but are arranged in beautiful pots or around some deco! The place is smaller than the other domes but there are so many flowers in such a small space you can easily spend hours in it. Not to mention there are waterfalls where waterfalls with patterns, photo locations to take photos.

Walked quite far from Ethnobotany Garden to reach here. And also next to Healing Garden.
The Fragrant Garden showcases many species of plants that have evolved to emit fragrances. The blooms attract butterflies and visitors will be able to spot these and other insects fluttering amongst the plants in the day. An ideal spot for night time visits as many of the plants give off their scents in the evenings.
The flowers of many plant species here didn't bloom, almost can't smell any fragrance here.
